Sec. 10-22.1. Same—Journeyman, master maintenance man, etc.
It shall be unlawful for any certified journeyman, master maintenance man, as defined by this chapter, operating anywhere within the County, to commit any one (1) or more of the following acts or omissions:
Perform work outside the scope of work the certificate holder is authorized to perform or to act as a contractor.
Depart from or disregard in any material respect the plans or specifications of a construction job without the consent of the qualifying agent.
Misrepresent any material fact in an application or supporting papers to obtain a certificate required by this chapter.
Intentionally evade or violate any of the provisions of this chapter, which may be evidenced by but not limited to one (1) or more of the following acts:
Aid or abet any person not holding a certificate of competency to evade or violate any of the provisions of this chapter, or
Allow a certificate to be used by an unauthorized person.
Commit any fraudulent act as a certificate holder by which another is substantially injured.
